sub_topic: Finding the area of a parallelogram.
message_1: A parallelogram has a base of 12cm and a height of 6cm. What is its area?
message_2:
The area of a parallelogram can be calculated using the formula:

Area = base × height

In this case, the base is 12 cm and the height is 6 cm. So, the area of the parallelogram is:

Area = 12 cm × 6 cm = 72 cm²
